Articles.Content:
Hi there. 
I've run in to a little problem with my game. 
When i start the game everything works nice and clean, but then suddently, all my crafts looses the connection with KSC. Even while they are still sitting on the launch pad. 

No matter how many antennas, and antenna size, the connection is still gone. 

Only thing that works, is to restart the game, but with 82 mods, it take some time to start up. 
After the restart my crafts have connection again, so its nnot the design of the craft.

Does anyone have an idea on how to solve this strange bug.

Maybe running out of power?

would help to see the log file

Edited October 9, 2019 by linuxgurugamer

21 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Maybe running out of power?

would help to see the log file

No, its not power. I press launch in VAB, with clamps, and a beefed up batteri, 1330 units of EC on the current craft. But its acts like i have no antennas installed (Got 4 on every craft, just to besure i have my connection until the primary antennas is activated)
If i restart the game, and launch the exact same craft, its all fine, and i got control of my craft, and a strong connection to the KSC. 

I play a couple of hours, no problem, and the suddently same issue. No connection to KSC. 

When i look at it, it kinda looks like im out of range, tho i am sitting on the launchpad. 
I will pull out a log from the debug menu, next time it happens.

1 minute ago, Aremos said:

When i look at it, it kinda looks like im out of range, tho i am sitting on the launchpad. 
I will pull out a log from the debug menu, next time it happens. 

That will be needed

4 hours ago, linuxgurugamer said:

That will be needed

Ok.
Not much to go for in the logs. 
Just keeps repeating ""Exeption: ArgumentOutOfRangeExeption: Argument is out of range. Parameter name: Index"

But you can get the log from here : https://1drv.ms/u/s!Ap0u0K8Bwg6rgqJHdYYDTnkDjTf3Pg?e=mxiOXR

11 minutes ago, Aremos said:

Ok.
Not much to go for in the logs. 
Just keeps repeating ""Exeption: ArgumentOutOfRangeExeption: Argument is out of range. Parameter name: Index"

But you can get the log from here : https://1drv.ms/u/s!Ap0u0K8Bwg6rgqJHdYYDTnkDjTf3Pg?e=mxiOXR

Remove KS3P, looks like that's a big part of your problem

4 hours ago, Aremos said:

Ok.
Not much to go for in the logs. 
Just keeps repeating ""Exeption: ArgumentOutOfRangeExeption: Argument is out of range. Parameter name: Index"

But you can get the log from here : https://1drv.ms/u/s!Ap0u0K8Bwg6rgqJHdYYDTnkDjTf3Pg?e=mxiOXR

If you are going to give a snippit of an error, you need to give the entire snippit.  What you gave above, besides being hand typed, didn't give any information as to where it happened.

After looking at your log file, it would have helped to post the snippet as follows: 

[EXC 00:31:46.343] ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range.
Parameter name: index
	System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String].get_Item (Int32 index)
	PartModule.ApplyUpgradeNode (System.Collections.Generic.List`1 appliedUps, .ConfigNode node, Boolean doLoad)
	ModuleDataTransmitter.CommPowerUnloaded (.ProtoPartModuleSnapshot mSnap)
	CommNet.CommNetVessel.UpdateComm ()
	CommNet.CommNetVessel.OnNetworkPreUpdate ()
	CommNet.CommNode.NetworkPreUpdate ()
	CommNet.Network.Net`4[_Net,_Data,_Link,_Path].PreUpdateNodes ()
	CommNet.Network.Net`4[_Net,_Data,_Link,_Path].Rebuild ()
	CommNet.CommNetwork.Rebuild ()
	CommNet.CommNetNetwork.Update ()

and 

[EXC 20:23:15.125] ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range.
Parameter name: index
	System.Collections.Generic.List`1[KSP_PostProcessing.Profile].get_Item (Int32 index)
	KSP_PostProcessing.KS3P.Register (KSP_PostProcessing.PostProcessingBehaviour target, Scene targetScene)
	KSP_PostProcessing.Operators.FlightOperator.Update ()

In this case, it doesn't really help, other that to show that it seems to be in the part upgrades section.

Looking at  your file, I see lots of errors.

While I'm not sure if it is impacting, you have a huge number of errors in KS3P, so I'd recommend removing that to start.

It also seems that as time goes on, every time you switch to flight, there are more errors.

It's going to be a pain, but you really should look at the file and start to fix the earlier errors.  Remove mods which aren't needed (graphical ones come to mind), autopilots, etc.  Something is causing the game to get confused, and you need to figure out what.

Nooo. Not my graphics

Lots of mods, and using every single one. 
I have allready removed a lot of addons (Had 100+ mods, down to 82) 
 

The graphics stay, i cant stand vanilla ksp looks. 
Got kramax autopilot, that i can get rid of, for the time being. Arent doing many kerbinside flights these days. 

Gonna take a look on the other mods, there might be one or two more i can throw out. 

Hopefully not one of yours  

 

Anyways thanks for the help man, you are a guru here
